Authors:
zhang qiong, zhao Lei, Ryan A. Folk, Zhao Jian Li, Nelson
A. Zamora, Pamela S. Soltis, Douglas E. Soltis, Yang Shi Xiong, Gao Lian
Ming, Peng Hua, yu xiang qin
Title:
Transcriptome-based phylogeny and whole-genome duplication in
Theaceae
Keywords:
Theaceae, phylogeny, transcriptome, low-copy nuclear
genes, phylogenetic network, whole-genome duplication
Abstract:
Theaceae, with three tribes, nine genera and more than 200
species, are of great economic and ecological importance. Recent
phylogenetic analyses based on plastome data resolved the relationships
among the three tribes and the intergeneric relationships within two of
those tribes. However, generic-level relationships within the largest
tribe, Theeae, were not fully resolved. The role of putative WGD events
in the family and possible hybridization events among genera within
Theeae also remains to be tested further.
